To use the information from the features `a`, `b`, and `c` at time `t+1` to help improve the prediction of the `return_t+3` value, you can simply include those values as additional features in your dataframe. Then, when you train your model, it will be able to use the information from the `a`, `b`, and `c` values at both time `t` and time `t+1` to make more accurate predictions.

Here is one way you could do this:

1. Create new columns in your dataframe for the `a`, `b`, and `c` values at time `t+1`.
2. Copy the values from the `a`, `b`, and `c` columns at time `t+1` into the new columns you created.
3. Train your model using the updated dataframe with the additional `a`, `b`, and `c` columns.

Here is an example of how you could implement these steps:
```
# create new columns in the dataframe for the 'a', 'b', and 'c' values at time 't+1'
df['a_t+1'] = df['a_t+1']
df['b_t+1'] = df['b_t+1']
df['c_t+1'] = df['c_t+1']

# train your model using the updated dataframe with the additional 'a', 'b', and 'c' columns
model.train(df)
```
Note that the specific steps you need to take will depend on the details of your data and your model. This is just one example of how you could approach this problem.
